result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:11 PM 
Defendant Angela Mae Farrey in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Angela Mae Farrey.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Witt informs the court this matter is close to resolution and moves to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:35 PM 
Defendant Angela Mae Farrey in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Angela Mae Farrey. 
Attorney Witt informs the court his Client wishes to waive her right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: her right to preliminary hearing.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions counsel re: his clients waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders bind over. 

Information has been filed.
Defendant acknowledges information and waives formal reading.

"NOT GUILTY" entered on all counts.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Fax Confirmation to LCSO of Signature Bond Signed

Defendant shall not possess or consume any nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Derrick Jack.

4:01 PM 
Defendant Angela Mae Farrey in court Attorney Adam Witt appears by video for intake purposes.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant and Attorney Witt acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court informs the defendant of her right to counsel.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel. 

Court Orders:
$1500.00 Signature Bond
-Not drive without valid DL
-No controlled substances
-No contact Darrick Jack
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on July 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Return on warrant on July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

1:01 PM 
Defendant Angela Mae Farrey not in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause for filing.

Court will order a "BODY ONLY" - Warrant non appearance.
So ordered.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license.
